title.value: How Do Open Source Software Contributors Perceive and Address Usability? Valued Factors, Practices, and Challenges
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the document, indicating the focus of the research paper.
title.quote: How Do Open Source Software Contributors Perceive and Address Usability? Valued Factors, Practices, and Challenges

extractions.description: This paper explores how open source software contributors perceive and address usability in their projects. It shares insights from a survey involving 84 contributors, highlighting valued factors, practices, and challenges concerning usability in OSS development.

type.justification: The study is based on a survey of 84 contributors, indicating that it involves empirical research based on data collection and analysis.
type.quote: We accumulated this knowledge through a survey with a wide range of contributors to OSS applications.

name.justification: The focus on open source software usability situates the research within the broader field of Software Engineering.
name.quote: usability in open source software (OSS) is an increasing concern, and this paper examines valued factors, practices, and challenges related to it.

name.justification: The paper specifically focuses on the usability of open source software, highlighting the valued factors and challenges in achieving it.
name.quote: Understanding the diverse needs and consolidating various feedback of end-users posed unique challenges for the OSS contributors when addressing usability.
